questions.question: Jenny drops some of her ice cream on a hot sidewalk. Which of the following happens next?

choices.answer: The temperature of the sidewalk and ice cream do not change.
Heat from the sidewalk is transferred to the ice cream.
The temperature of the ice cream increases as cold travels
Cold from the ice cream is transferred to the sidewalk.

questions.question: Erin places ice cubes into freshly made tea that is still warm. What happens to the ice cubes?

choices.answer: Heat from the tea is transferred to the ice cubes
The cold from the ice cubes is transferred to the tea.
The temperature of the ice cubes remains the same.
Heat transfer causes the temperature of the tea to increase.

questions.question: Kurt sets his plate down outside and then goes back inside to answer his phone.  What happens?

choices.answer: Cold from the air makes the food the same temperature
Cold from the air makes the food colder than the air
Heat from the food tranfers to the air
Heat from the air transfers to the food

questions.question: Sam places objects in a beaker of water that is 100 degrees Celsius. Describe the flow of heat.

choices.answer: Heat from the water moves into Objects A, B, & C
Heat from the water moves into Object A only
Heat from Object C moves into the water and Objects A & B
Heat from the water moves into Objects A & B but not C

questions.question: Jay places a pot of cold water on a hot stove and then turns off the stove.  What happens?

choices.answer: Stove temp decreases but water temp remains the same
Water temp increases
Stove temp decreases
Water temp increases and stove temp decreases

questions.question: Vinnie places his cold drink on the roof of a hot car. What is the best next step?

choices.answer: The temp of the drink increases as cold moves into the car
Cold is transferred from the drink to the car
Heat is transferred from the car to the drink.
The temperature of the roof under the drink decreases

questions.question: On a cold day, Rick puts a hot cup of coffee down on a picnic table.  What happens next?

choices.answer: The heat of the coffee cup is transferred to the table
The temp. of the picnic table decreases as cold transfers
The table transfers its cold temperature to the coffee cup.
The coffee cup remains the same temperature

questions.question: Eric places some room-temperature strawberries into his freezer.  What happens to the berries?

choices.answer: The heat from the strawberries is transferred to the freezer
The temperature of the freezer remains the same
The cold of the freezer is transferred to the berries
Heat is transferred from the freezer to the berries

questions.question: Tess places two marbles in a beaker of 100 degrees Celsius water.  How will the heat flow?

choices.answer: from the blue marble to the water
from the water to the blue marble
from the red marble to the beaker
from the blue marble to the red

questions.question: Alec places a jar of cold mustard on a counter at room temperature. What happens after 3 hours?

choices.answer: The jar and counter become the same temperature as the room
The counter releases heat to the jar and they get colder
The counter gains heat.
The jar loses cold to the surrounding air

questions.question: A cup of hot cocoa cools down if left on the counter.  Which best explains this?

choices.answer: The chocolate molecules absorb heat from the drink
Cold from the surrounding air flows to the hot chocolate
The material of the cup absorbs heat from the hot chocolate.
Heat from the hot chocolate flows to the cooler air

questions.question: A spoon in bowl of hot soup becomes hot.  What explains this observation?

choices.answer: the flow of heat from the soup to the spoon
the flow of heat from the spoon to the soup
the flow of heat from the surrounding air to the spoon
the flow of heat from the spoon to the surrounding air

questions.question: What is happening to the molecules in an ice cube as it sits at room temperature and melts?

choices.answer: The molecules are absorbing energy and slowing down
The molecules are absorbing energy and speeding up
The molecules are releasing energy and slowing down
The molecules are releasing energy and speeding up

questions.question: When heat is added or removed from a substance the temperature changes. What else could happen?

choices.answer: a change in state
a change in color
a change in the boiling point
a change in the melting point

questions.question: When you step from the shower on a cold day, why does the tile floor seem colder than the air?

choices.answer: the tile is colder
the air is colder
the tile has a lower specific heat
the tile has a higher specific heat

questions.question: What type of heat transfer is taking place?

choices.answer: transformation
conduction
convection
radiation

questions.question: What type of heat transfer is taking place?

choices.answer: conduction
convection
radiation
conduction, convection, and radiation

questions.question: Describe the flow of thermal energy.

choices.answer: Heat flows from your hands to the cup
Heat flows from the cup to the air
Heat flows from the cup to the air and  your hands
Cold flows from the air to the cup and your hands

questions.question: Describe the relationship between kinetic energy and temperature.

choices.answer: Higher temperature equals more kinetic energy
Lower temperature equals more kinetic energy
Higher temperature equals more thermal energy
Lower temperature equals more thermal energy

questions.question: Describe the flow of thermal energy.

choices.answer: Heat flows from the water to the air.
Heat flows from the stove to the water
Heat flows from the pan to the water
Heat flows from the stove to the pan, water, and the air

questions.question: Why does the sun make you feel warm?

choices.answer: Temperature flows from the sun to the earth
Thermal energy flows from the earth to the sun
Thermal energy flows from the sun to the earth
The sun is hot

questions.question: How does meat get heated in a frying pan?

choices.answer: radiation
conduction
convection
specific heat

questions.question: Why do smoke and hot air go up a chimney?

choices.answer: radiation
conduction
convection
transformation

questions.question: What happens if you remove heat from water by putting it in the freezer?

choices.answer: The water remains the same
The water turns into a gas
Cold leaves the freezer and enters the water
The water freezes into a solid.
